1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: EDITSTR.C Fri 10-27-2000 8:53:26 pm HvA V2.01 $
3    | 
4    | DESC: String edit routines for HVA_WIN
5    | HIST: 19900818 V1.00
6    | 	  20001027 V2.01 - Adapted for DJGPP
7    | ***************************************************************************/
8    | 
9    | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10   |                         HEADER FILES
11   | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
12   | #include <stdio.h>
13   | #include <stdlib.h>
14   | #include <conio.h>
15   | #include <string.h>
16   | #include <ctype.h>
17   | #include "video/v_video.h"
18   | #include "keys.h"
19   | #include "window.h"
20   | 
21   | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
22   |                         PROTOTYPES
23   | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
24   | static void display_line(int l);
25   | 
26   | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
27   |                         CONSTANTS
28   | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
29   | 
30   | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31   |                         LOCAL VARIABLES
32   | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
33   | static int maxcol = 0;
34   | static int len = 0;             /* Current string length                */
35   | static char disp_str[132];       /* String to display                    */
36   | static WINDOW *w;               /* Ptr to window structure (if wanted)  */
37   | static int startrow,startcol;
38   | static int row,col;             /* Actual row and colum                 */
39   | static int pos;                 /* pointer to next char to edit         */
40   | static int sstart;              /* First character to display ( >= 0    */
41   | static char empty_str[132];  /* Dummy string to clear window         */
42   | static char s[80];              /* Temporary edit string                */
43   | 
44   | extern SCREEN _cursvar;
45   | 
46   | /*==============================================================================
47   |                         START OF FUNCTIONS
48   | ==============================================================================*/
49   | 
50   | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
51   |     FUNCTION: editstr()
52   |      PURPOSE: Edit string
53   |  DESCRIPTION: Feels like the TURBO integrated enviroment string editing
54   |      RETURNS: Last character typed
55   |      HISTORY: 900902 V0.3 - x
56   |               910716 V0.4 - Adapted for new window enviroment
57   |               910826 V0.5 - Now returns last character typed
58   |               930101 V0.6 - 3rd parameter is now the length of the window.
59   |               931012 V0.7 - Adjust wn_open() for borders including...
60   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
61   | int editstr(int srow, int scol, int l, char *header, char *str, int w_flag)
62   | {
63   |   int c_flag = TRUE;     /* Cursor OFF flag              */
64   |   int i;
65   |   unsigned int key;      /* Scancode of key pressed      */
66   |   int key_stat;          /* Key status                   */
67   |   int firstkey = TRUE;   /* Flag for for first key press */
68   | 
69   |   /*----------------
70   |     Save variables
71   |   ----------------*/
72   |   startrow = srow;
73   |   startcol = scol;
74   | 
75   |   if (startrow == -1) startrow = action_row + 2;
76   |   if (startcol == -1) startcol = action_col + 2;
77   | 
78   |   maxcol = startcol + l -1;  /* Maximum column position of cursor     */
79   | 
80   |   /* CHECK IF WINDOW WITHIN BOUNDARIES
81   |   ------------------------------------*/
82   |   startcol = minmax(0,startcol,_cursvar.cols-l);
83   |   startrow = minmax(0,startrow,_cursvar.lines);
84   | 
85   |   /* DRAW THE EDIT WINDOW
86   |   -----------------------*/
87   |   if (w_flag)
88   |   {
89   |     /*-------------------------------------------------------
90   |       l is the number of characters to display,
91   |       but use l+2 to reserve space for the '<' and '>'
92   |       931012 V0.7: add another 2 for xsize and ysize of window
93   |                    to include borders
94   |     ------------------------------------------------------*/
95   |     w = wn_open(_SINGLE_LINE, startrow-1, startcol-1,
96   |                 l+4,3,_window_att,_border_att);
97   |     wn_sync(w,TRUE);          /* Set cursor on flag      */
98   |     wn_fixcsr(w);             /* Update cursor in window */
99   |     wn_title(w,header);
100  |   }
101  |   else
102  |     w = wn_open(_NO_BORDER, startrow, startcol, l+2, 1,
103  |                 _window_att,_border_att);
104  | 
105  |   /*-----------------------------
106  |     Clear string s and empty_str
107  |   ------------------------------*/
108  |   memset(s,'\0',80);
109  |   memset(empty_str,' ',l);
110  |   empty_str[l] = '\0';
111  | 
112  |   /*---------------------
113  |     Initialize variables
114  |   ----------------------*/
115  |   len = strlen(str);           /* Determine string length */
116  |   strcpy(s,str);               /* Original str will be used with ESCaping */
117  |   row = startrow;
118  |   col = startcol;
119  |   pos = len;                      /* Set character pointer after last char */
120  |   col += pos;                     /* Set cursor column                     */
121  | 
122  |   display_line(l);
123  | 
124  |   /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
125  |     After each process the following rules have to be true:
126  | 
127  |     - pos will point to the next position in the string to process.
128  |     - col (cursorcolumn) on the screen will indicate the next position.
129  |     - len is the actual lenght of the string
130  |   ---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
131  | 
132  |   do
133  |   {
134  |     /* GET A KEY AND KEYBOARD STATUS
135  |     --------------------------------*/
136  |     key = waitkey();
137  |     key_stat = shift_status();
138  | 
139  |     /* THREAT FIRST KEYPRESS SPECIAL
140  |     --------------------------------*/
141  |     if (firstkey)
142  |     {
143  |       firstkey = FALSE;
144  |       if (isalnum(key))               /* Alpha numberic char ?  */
145  |       {                               /* Start with new string  */
146  |         v_prints(startrow,startcol,empty_str);
147  |         s[0] = (char) key;            /* Store key in string    */
148  |         for (i=1 ; i<80 ; i++)        /* Fill string with NIL's */
149  |           s[i] = '\0';
150  |         pos = 1;                      /* Reset string pointer   */
151  |         col = startcol+1;             /* Reset column           */
152  |         len = 1;                      /* Reset string length    */
153  |         display_line(l);
154  |         continue;
155  |       }
156  |     }
157  | 
158  |     switch (key) {
159  |       case ARROW_LEFT:
160  |         if (key_stat & (RIGHT_SHIFT|LEFT_SHIFT)) {
161  |           col = startcol;
162  |           pos = 0;          /* Put cursor on first character */
163  |         }
164  |         else {
165  |           if (pos > 0)      /* Cursor one character to left  */
166  |             pos--;
167  |           if (!sstart)      /* If not truncated to left ...  */
168  |             col--;
169  |         }
170  |         break;
171  | 
172  | /*    --------------  startcol 0 ; l 10 ; len 10 ; maxcol 10
173  |       |<012345678_>|
174  |       --------------
175  | */
176  |       case ARROW_RIGHT:
177  |         if (key_stat & (RIGHT_SHIFT|LEFT_SHIFT)) {
178  |           pos = len;                 /* Cursor after last character     */
179  |           col = min(startcol+len,maxcol);
180  |         }
181  |         else {                         /* Cursor 1 char to the right      */
182  |           if (pos < len) {             /* Stop at end of string           */
183  |             pos++;
184  |             col++;
185  |           }
186  |         }
187  |         break;
188  | 
189  |       case RETURN:
190  |         strcpy(str,s);
191  |         break;
192  | 
193  |       case BACKSPACE:     /* Delete character left of the cursor */
194  |         if (pos > 0)
195  |         { if (!sstart)             /* If no left-truncation      */
196  |             col--;
197  |           pos--;                   /* Generate new string        */
198  |           strcpy(s+pos,s+pos+1);
199  |           len--;                   /* Adjust length              */
200  |           i = startcol+len+1;
201  |           if (i <= maxcol)
202  |             v_printc(row,i,' ');   /* Delete last char on screen */
203  |         }
204  |         break;
205  | 
206  |       case DELETE:                 /* Delete character under the cursor */
207  |         if (s[pos] && pos >= 0)
208  |         {
209  |           len--;
210  |           i = startcol+len;
211  |           if (i <= maxcol)
212  |             v_printc(row,i,' ');   /* Delete last char on screen */
213  |           strcpy(s+pos,s+pos+1);   /* Generate new string        */
214  |         }
215  |         break;
216  | 
217  |       case HOME:         /* Cursor on first character */
218  |         pos = 0;
219  |         col = startcol;
220  |         break;
221  | 
222  |       case END_LINE:     /* Cursor after last character  */
223  |         pos = len;
224  |         col = min(startcol+len,maxcol);
225  |         break;
226  | 
227  |       default:
228  |         if (isprint(key & 0x00FF))
229  |         {
230  |           for (i=len ; i>=pos ; i--)
231  |             s[i] = s[i-1];
232  |           s[pos] = (char) (key & 0x00FF);
233  |           pos++;                 /* Adjust pointer           */
234  |           len++;                 /* Adjust string length     */
235  |           col++;
236  |         }
237  |     }
238  | 
239  |     display_line(l);
240  | 
241  |   }
242  |   while (key != ENTER && key != ESC);
243  | 
244  |   /* DELETE TRAILING BLANKS
245  |   -------------------------*/
246  |   i = len - 1;
247  |   while (isspace(s[i]) && i>=0)
248  |   {
249  |     s[i] = '\0';
250  |     i--;
251  |   }
252  | 
253  |   /* RESTORE CURSOR AND WINDOW
254  |   ----------------------------*/
255  |   if (!c_flag) v_cursoroff();
256  |   if (w_flag)
257  |     w = wn_close(w);
258  | 
259  |   return(key);
260  | }
261  | 
262  | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
263  |     FUNCTION: display_line()
264  |      PURPOSE: Display line for editstr()
265  |       SYNTAX: static void display_line(int l);
266  |  DESCRIPTION: -
267  |      RETURNS: nothing
268  |      HISTORY: 24-Feb-1992 10:02:00 V0.1 - Initial version
269  |               01-Jan-1993 20:30:11 V0.2 - added parameter 'l' for length
270  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
271  | static void display_line(int l)
272  | {
273  |   int i;
274  |   int left_flag,right_flag;
275  | 
276  |   /* SET VARIBLES WITHIN BOUNDARIES
277  |   ---------------------------------*/
278  |   col = minmax(startcol,col,maxcol);
279  |   pos = minmax(0,pos,80);
280  |   len = minmax(0,len,80);
281  | 
282  | /*    --------------
283  |       |<012345678_>|
284  |       --------------
285  | */
286  |   /* DETERMINE START OF STRING
287  |   ----------------------------*/
288  |   sstart = max(0,pos-l+1);
289  | 
290  |  /* CHECK ON TRUNCATION OF STRING
291  |   --------------------------------*/
292  |   i = max(pos,l-1);
293  |   left_flag  = sstart ? TRUE : FALSE;  /* Check left truncation   */
294  |   right_flag = s[i] ? TRUE : FALSE;    /* Check right truncation  */
295  | 
296  | /*  --------------
297  |     |<012345678_>|
298  |     --------------
299  | */
300  | 
301  |   /*-----------------------------------
302  |     Initialize the string to display
303  |   ------------------------------------*/
304  |   s[len] = '\0';                        /* Alway's terminate string  */
305  |   memset(disp_str,' ',l);               /* Initialize display string */
306  |   strncpy(disp_str,s+sstart,l);         /* sstart is minimal 0       */
307  |   strcat(disp_str," ");
308  |   disp_str[l] = '\0';                   /* Alway's terminate display string */
309  | 
310  |   /*------------------------------------------------
311  |     Show the string.
312  |     Use startcol+1 to leave space for the '<' sign
313  |   -------------------------------------------------*/
314  |   v_prints(startrow,startcol+1,disp_str);
315  | 
316  |   /*------------------------
317  |     If truncation, show it
318  |   -------------------------*/
319  |   v_printc(row, maxcol+2, right_flag ? 0x10 : ' ');
320  |   v_printc(row, startcol, left_flag ? 0x11 : ' ');
321  | 
322  |   /*---------------------------------------------------------
323  |     If cursor just after last character of the string, and
324  |     this would be just before the '>' sign, then print a
325  |     space on this place. This is a fucking exception !
326  |   ---------------------------------------------------------*/
327  |   if (col == maxcol && !right_flag)
328  |     v_printc(row,col+1,' ');
329  | 
330  |   /*-------------------------------------
331  |     Set cursor on the character to edit
332  |   ---------------------------------------*/
333  |   v_setcurpos(row,col+1);
334  | }
335  | 
